docs.snippet: Alex Rodriguez’s home run started a comeback in a highly contentious and emotional game as the Yankees moved to seven and a half games back of the Red Sox in the American League East....
docs.lead_paragraph: Alex Rodriguez’s home run started a comeback in a highly contentious and emotional game as the Yankees moved to seven and a half games back of the Red Sox in the American League East.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees beat Boston Red Sox, 9-6; Yankees slugger Alex Rodriguez hits home run in response to apparently being intentionally hit with pitch, galvanizing his team.

headline.main: Hit by Pitch, Rodriguez Recovers, as Do Yanks

docs.snippet: Brian Cashman called Alex Rodriguez a liar, and Randy Levine said he needed to “put up or shut up.” Rodriguez and his camp, meanwhile, were planning to file a formal grievance against the Yankees....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brian Cashman called Alex Rodriguez a liar, and Randy Levine said he needed to “put up or shut up.” Rodriguez and his camp, meanwhile, were planning to file a formal grievance against the Yankees.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees star third baseman Alex Rodriguez and his camp are planning to file formal grievance against Yankees over their handling of his medical problems; general manager Brian Cashman, feeling betrayed and disappointed by his star player, calls Rodriguez a liar and says he no longer trusts him enough to discuss any substantive matters with him.

headline.main: More Friction Between Yankees and Rodriguez
headline.print_headline: Front Office Fires Back at Rodriguez

docs.snippet: What baseball game? With seemingly every type of play carrying a sponsor, radio announcers are increasingly reading ads that interrupt the action....
docs.lead_paragraph: What baseball game? With seemingly every type of play carrying a sponsor, radio announcers are increasingly reading ads that interrupt the action.
docs.abstract: Radio broadcasts of baseball games are increasingly peppered with in-game advertisements.

headline.main: Here’s the Pitch. But First, One From Our Sponsor.
